name: Vigabatrin

ingredients.name: SODIUM STARCH GLYCOLATE TYPE A POTATO

indications.text: vigabatrin tablets indicated treatment : refractory complex partial seizures adjunctive therapy patients 2 years age older responded inadequately several alternative treatments ; vigabatrin tablets indicated first line agent ( 1.1 )

contraindications.text: refractory complex partial seizures adults ( 17 years age older ) : initiate 1,000 mg/day ( 500 mg twice daily ) ; increase total daily dose weekly 500 mg/day increments , recommended dose 3,000 mg/day ( 1,500 mg twice daily ) ( 2.2 ) pediatric ( 2 16 years age ) : recommended based body weight administered two divided doses ( 2.2 ) may increased weekly intervals , depending response ( 2.2 ) dose patients weighing 60 kg according adult recommendations ( 2.2 ) renal impairment : dose adjustment recommended ( 2.4 , 8.5 , 8.6 )

indications_original: Vigabatrin tablets are indicated for the treatment of: Refractory Complex Partial Seizures as adjunctive therapy in patients 2 years of age and older who have responded inadequately to several alternative treatments; Vigabatrin tablets are not indicated as a first line agent ( 1.1 )
contraindications_original: Refractory Complex Partial Seizures Adults (17 years of age and older): Initiate at 1,000 mg/day (500 mg twice daily); increase total daily dose weekly in 500 mg/day increments, to the recommended dose of 3,000 mg/day (1,500 mg twice daily) ( 2.2 ) Pediatric (2 to 16 years of age): The recommended dosage is based on body weight and administered as two divided doses ( 2.2 ) The dosage may be increased in weekly intervals, depending on response ( 2.2 ) Dose patients weighing more than 60 kg according to adult recommendations ( 2.2 ) Renal Impairment : Dose adjustment recommended ( 2.4 , 8.5 , 8.6 )
